#102

Should just release a remaster of the original with 4K, 60fps, new lighting, new models & textures. Kinda the treatment Nintendo gave to OoT 3D where it's improvements to the original experience without being a ground up remake.

Ubisoft already fucked up a relatively basic remaster with the PS3 version of Sands of Time and its never-patched audio issues, so I think I'm glad they went with a remake for this one.

Switch version is getting canned, isn't it?

I think that will depend on what kind of resources Ubisoft Montreal get to throw at it and how they decide to develop it. It's hardly going to be their main focus, but if they remake it in Anvil that might allow for a Switch version. Ubisoft Quebec got Immortals running on Switch so I think there's some chance of a similar port for this.

Unless the Switch is superseded by the end of its development, which is a completely plausible scenario.

It looked terrible so its a good choice but I have no idea why they gave a new studio such a big project.

The studio isn't really new, it was founded in 2006 by Gameloft and bought by Ubisoft in 2008. It's been a mobile studio for most of that time though. I think Ubisoft's aim was fairly clear - to give their now-huge mobile studio a chance to do a console game. The choice of game was pretty good too since it was popular, ran on older hardware, and they had a known solid base to work from. It really shouldn't have run into too many issues, but it's clearly had a troubled development between the terrible art choice, the impact of Covid, and probably some other troubles we don't know about.
